main.java.model

Class CodeQualityRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.model.CodeQualityRule

  • public class CodeQualityRule
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a rule based on predetermined or user-defined metrics and thresholds to detect code defects and thus determine code quality

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long id
      Timestamp which allows us to ID the rules
      private boolean isAdvanced
      If the rule should be opened in advanced mode for edition
      private boolean isDefault
      If the rule is a default rule or new rule added by the user
      private java.lang.String name
      Rule's name
      private java.lang.String rule
      The rule's conditions

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeQualityRule

        public CodeQualityRule(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String rule,
                       boolean isDefault,
                       boolean isAdvanced)
        Creates a CodeQualityRule object based on:
        Parameters:
        name - - rule's name, shown in UI
        rule - - rule's content, ie, the conditions that define it
        isDefault - - if a rule is default, only its thresholds can be edited
        isAdvanced - - if a rule is advanced, it can never be opened in the basic UI

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Changes the rule's name to a new one
        Parameters:
        name - - rule's new name. Only changes if it isn't a default rule

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the rule's name
        Returns:
        String name - rule's name

      • setRule

        public void setRule(java.lang.String rule)
        Changes the rule's conditions
        Parameters:
        rule - - rule's new conditions.

      • getRule

        public java.lang.String getRule()
        Returns the rule's conditions
        Returns:
        String rule - rule's conditions

      • isDefault

        public boolean isDefault()
        Returns boolean that determines if a rule is default or not A default rule is a rule that can't have its metrics edited only its thresholds
        Returns:
        boolean isDefault - if a rule is default or not

      • setAdvanced

        public void setAdvanced(boolean isAdvanced)
        Sets the state of the rule, determining if it is an advanced rule or a basic one. If it's a default rule, considers it for edition only in advanced mode.
        Parameters:
        isAdvanced - - if a rule should be opened in advanced mode

      • isAdvanced

        public boolean isAdvanced()
        Returns boolean that determines if a rule is advanced or not. An advanced rule can't be edited with the basic rule editor
        Returns:
        boolean isAdvanced - if a rule should be opened in advanced mode

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Makes it so that a CodeQualityRule is displayed by its name
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String name - rule's name

      • equals

        public boolean equals(CodeQualityRule otherRule)
        Establishes a way of comparing rules based on their id
        Parameters:
        otherRule - - receives another rule and compares it to this one based on their id
        Returns:
        true if rules have the same id, false otherwise

      • setId

        public void setId(long newId)
        Sets a new ID for the rule
        Parameters:
        newId - - the new long value being set

      • getID

        public long getID()
        Getter for the rule's ID value
        Returns:
        long value with the rule's ID
